function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reliance on big data analytics for real-time contact tracing can result in privacy breaches and data security risks.","Impact":"Potential exposure of sensitive health and location data, leading to privacy violations and identity theft.","Mitigation":"Implement robust data encryption, stringent access controls, and anonymization techniques to protect personal data.","Technologies":"Data encryption, access control technologies, anonymization techniques","People":"Individuals with personal health and location data, potential fraud victims","Owner":"Data privacy experts, cybersecurity professionals"},{"Description":"Utilization of ontological reasoning and knowledge graphs may lead to inaccuracies in COVID-19 analytics and recommendations.","Impact":"Inaccurate predictions and recommendations that could result in ineffective public health policies and interventions.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and verification of the ontological reasoning models, and integration of real-time data for accuracy and relevance.","Technologies":"Validation and verification tools, real-time data integration technologies","People":"Public health officials, policymakers","Owner":"Data scientists, public health experts"},{"Description":"Lack of systematic studies exploring the utilization of ontologies in designing and supporting COVID-19 analytics can lead to limited understanding and suboptimal use of ontological solutions.","Impact":"Missed opportunities for leveraging ontological solutions to improve COVID-19 analytics and response strategies.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive research and studies to explore and document the effectiveness and best practices in utilizing ontologies for COVID-19 analytics.","Technologies":"Research methodologies, data analysis tools","People":"Researchers, data analysts","Owner":"Research institutions, academic organizations"}]}
